Here is a sample Policy on the Use of Encryption for the Shipfinex platform:

1. Purpose: The purpose of this policy is to outline the procedures for the use of encryption on the Shipfinex platform to protect sensitive information.
2. Definitions:
a. Encryption: The process of converting plain text into a coded form that cannot be easily understood by unauthorized parties.
b. Sensitive Information: Any data that is classified as confidential or private and must be protected from unauthorized access.
3. Scope: This policy applies to all sensitive information processed by the Shipfinex platform.
4. Encryption Requirements:
a. The Shipfinex platform will use encryption to protect sensitive information both in transit and at rest.
b. The platform will use encryption algorithms that have been approved by industry standards and are recognized as secure.
c. Encryption keys must be kept secure and must not be shared with unauthorized personnel.
5. Data Transfer: When transmitting sensitive information, the Shipfinex platform will use encrypted protocols such as SSL/TLS to protect the data in transit.
6. Data Storage: The Shipfinex platform will encrypt sensitive information stored on its servers and in its databases to prevent unauthorized access.
7. Key Management: The Shipfinex platform will implement a secure key management system to ensure that encryption keys are kept secure and are not lost or stolen.
8. Training: All employees of the Shipfinex platform will receive training on the proper use of encryption and the handling of sensitive information.
9. Monitoring and Review: The Shipfinex platform will regularly review and monitor its encryption practices to ensure that they are in compliance with this policy and with all relevant laws and regulations.

This Policy on the Use of Encryption provides a general outline of the procedures that the Shipfinex platform can implement to protect sensitive information through the use of encryption. The exact procedures may vary based on the specific needs and requirements of the platform and the jurisdiction in which it operates.
